channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown bush, 9th September
item.description:
Covering most of the path, have to get muddy to pass when it's wet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Willowbrook Drive, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Timing has slipped, 9th September
item.description:
The Lights were set at 28 seconds, Coming up princess elizabeth rd, For several weeks it has slipped to 22 seconds. As we all know it takes time for cars to get moving, And by 20 seconds, its just getting going, So after 22 seconds more cars move in the lost 6 seconds, Than the first 15 seconds. The ques first thing, And late afternoon, Are totally unnecessary, and causing more pollution, Please sort it. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of crossing facilities still, 9th September
item.description:

item.title: Parking on double yellows outside school, 9th September
item.description:
This car was parked badly, on a bend, on double yellow lines, outside of a school at 14.40 today (9th September). This was on the corner of Martindale Road in Churchdown.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Craven Drive, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Tarmac ramp onto the road, 9th September
item.description:
When the new cycle track was built a temporary tarmac ramp was built from the Road to the pavement. This has not been removed presenting a danger to cyclists who could hit as it comes out into the carriageway. Needs to be removed urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers up for almost six months, closing our entrance to basement and stopping scheduled renovation work, 9th September
item.description:
Between No. 24 and No. 26 Albert Place We cannot access our basement steps and are not able to continue necessary restoration work because of the barriers. Pothole is probably due to water ingress under the pavement which has also damaged our wall which is bulging and urgently needs repair. The barriers are also causing people having to get off the pavement and walk on the street, putting them in danger, especially when using prams or wheelchairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Albert Place, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repaired 2 weeks ago, failed already, 9th September
item.description:
What a waste of council money. I reported a sink hole, council came and banged some tarmac in it, 2 weeks later it has fallen into the hole. The whole section has voids under the covers. See the pictures, needs a proper repair, not amateur hour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Wheatland Drive, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 9th September
item.description:
Cheltenham Basement flat, water is running into the bathroom. Customer wondering if a drain servay can be done/ clearing of the drain
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged pavement/ entrance to car park, 9th September
item.description:
Hi , there is a problem with the entrance to the car park at the bottom of ogbourne close in Longlevens. The car park belongs to flats 3,4,5,6 & 7 which are of the address , The Parade, Nine Elms road, GL2 0HE. 3 tenants have damaged their cars recently coming in and out of the car park. The surface is uneven from where a fence was at one point but the other issue is the slope I believe causing cars to scrape the bottom of their car on the floor. We would like to have this fixed but are away the problem extends on the the public footpath so was hoping you could advise us how to proceed Many thanks Lee Burby ( flat 7 owner )

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ogbourne Close, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
